content.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate scryptCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/src/scrypt/lib.rs.html#1-120)
Expand description
This crate implements the Scrypt key derivation function as specified in [1].
If you are only using the low-level [`scrypt`](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/fn.scrypt.html "fn scrypt::scrypt") function instead of the higher-level [`Scrypt`](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Scrypt.html "struct scrypt::Scrypt") struct to produce/verify hash strings, it’s recommended to disable default features in your `Cargo.toml`:
```
[dependencies]
scrypt = { version = "0.2", default-features = false }
```

## [§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#usage-simple-with-default-params)Usage (simple with default params)
```
use scrypt::{
  password_hash::{
    rand_core::OsRng,
    PasswordHash, PasswordHasher, PasswordVerifier, SaltString
  },
  Scrypt
};
let password = b"hunter42"; // Bad password; don't actually use!
let salt = SaltString::generate(&mut OsRng);
// Hash password to PHC string ($scrypt$...)
let password_hash = Scrypt.hash_password(password, &salt)?.to_string();
// Verify password against PHC string
let parsed_hash = PasswordHash::new(&password_hash)?;
assert!(Scrypt.verify_password(password, &parsed_hash).is_ok());
```

## [§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#references)References
[1] - [C. Percival. Stronger Key Derivation Via Sequential Memory-Hard Functions](http://www.tarsnap.com/scrypt/scrypt.pdf)
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#reexports)

`pub use password_hash[](https://docs.rs/password-hash/0.5.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/password_hash/index.html "mod password_hash");`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#modules)

[errors](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/errors/index.html "mod scrypt::errors")
    Errors for `scrypt` operations.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#structs)

[Params](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Params.html "struct scrypt::Params")
    The Scrypt parameter values.

[Scrypt](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Scrypt.html "struct scrypt::Scrypt")
    scrypt type for use with [`PasswordHasher`](https://docs.rs/password-hash/0.5.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/password_hash/traits/trait.PasswordHasher.html "trait password_hash::traits::PasswordHasher").
## Constants[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#constants)

[ALG_ID](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/constant.ALG_ID.html "constant scrypt::ALG_ID")
    Algorithm identifier
## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#functions)

[scrypt](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/fn.scrypt.html "fn scrypt::scrypt")
    The scrypt key derivation function.

```
use scrypt::{
  password_hash::{
    rand_core::OsRng,
```

# RustCrypto: scrypt
[![crate](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/scrypt)](https://crates.io/crates/scrypt) [![Docs](https://img.gs/czjpqfbdkz/full/https://docs.rs/scrypt/badge.svg)](https://docs.rs/scrypt/) [![Build Status](https://img.gs/czjpqfbdkz/full/https://github.com/RustCrypto/password-hashes/workflows/scrypt/badge.svg?branch=master&event=push)](https://github.com/RustCrypto/password-hashes/actions?query=workflow%3Ascrypt) ![Apache2/MIT licensed](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache2.0/MIT-blue.svg) ![Rust Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/rustc-1.60+-blue.svg) [![Project Chat](https://img.shields.io/badge/zulip-join_chat-blue.svg)](https://rustcrypto.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/260046-password-hashes)
Pure Rust implementation of the [scrypt key derivation function](https://www.tarsnap.com/scrypt.html).
[Documentation](https://docs.rs/scrypt/)
## Minimum Supported Rust Version
Rust **1.60** or higher.
Minimum supported Rust version can be changed in the future, but it will be done with a minor version bump.
## SemVer Policy
  * All on-by-default features of this library are covered by SemVer
  * MSRV is considered exempt from SemVer as noted above


## License
Licensed under either of:
  * [Apache License, Version 2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0)
  * [MIT license](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)


at your option.
### Contribution
Unless you explicitly state otherwise, any contribution intentionally submitted for inclusion in the work by you, as defined in the Apache-2.0 license, shall be dual licensed as above, without any additional terms or conditions.
#### Dependencies
~1MB  ~25K SLoC
  * [simple](https://lib.rs/crates/scrypt/features#feature-simple "default feature") [std](https://lib.rs/crates/scrypt/features#feature-std "default feature") [password-hash](https://lib.rs/crates/password-hash "new") 0.6.0-rc.0[+rand_core](https://lib.rs/crates/password-hash/features#feature-rand_core)
  * [pbkdf2](https://lib.rs/crates/pbkdf2 "new") =0.13.0-pre.1
  * [salsa20](https://lib.rs/crates/salsa20 "new") =0.11.0-pre.2
  * [sha2](https://lib.rs/crates/sha2 "obsolete") =0.11.0-pre.4


  *[SLoC]: approx. additional lines of code

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate scryptCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/src/scrypt/lib.rs.html#1-120)
Expand description
This crate implements the Scrypt key derivation function as specified in [1].
If you are only using the low-level [`scrypt`](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/fn.scrypt.html "fn scrypt::scrypt") function instead of the higher-level [`Scrypt`](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Scrypt.html "struct scrypt::Scrypt") struct to produce/verify hash strings, it’s recommended to disable default features in your `Cargo.toml`:
```
[dependencies]
scrypt = { version = "0.2", default-features = false }
```

## [§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#usage-simple-with-default-params)Usage (simple with default params)
```
use scrypt::{
  password_hash::{
    rand_core::OsRng,
    PasswordHash, PasswordHasher, PasswordVerifier, SaltString
  },
  Scrypt
};
let password = b"hunter42"; // Bad password; don't actually use!
let salt = SaltString::generate(&mut OsRng);
// Hash password to PHC string ($scrypt$...)
let password_hash = Scrypt.hash_password(password, &salt)?.to_string();
// Verify password against PHC string
let parsed_hash = PasswordHash::new(&password_hash)?;
assert!(Scrypt.verify_password(password, &parsed_hash).is_ok());
```

## [§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#references)References
[1] - [C. Percival. Stronger Key Derivation Via Sequential Memory-Hard Functions](http://www.tarsnap.com/scrypt/scrypt.pdf)
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#reexports)

`pub use password_hash[](https://docs.rs/password-hash/0.5.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/password_hash/index.html "mod password_hash");`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#modules)

[errors](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/errors/index.html "mod scrypt::errors")
    Errors for `scrypt` operations.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#structs)

[Params](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Params.html "struct scrypt::Params")
    The Scrypt parameter values.

[Scrypt](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Scrypt.html "struct scrypt::Scrypt")
    scrypt type for use with [`PasswordHasher`](https://docs.rs/password-hash/0.5.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/password_hash/traits/trait.PasswordHasher.html "trait password_hash::traits::PasswordHasher").
## Constants[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#constants)

[ALG_ID](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/constant.ALG_ID.html "constant scrypt::ALG_ID")
    Algorithm identifier
## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#functions)

[scrypt](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/fn.scrypt.html "fn scrypt::scrypt")
    The scrypt key derivation function.

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate scryptCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/src/scrypt/lib.rs.html#1-120)
Expand description
This crate implements the Scrypt key derivation function as specified in [1].
If you are only using the low-level [`scrypt`](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/fn.scrypt.html "fn scrypt::scrypt") function instead of the higher-level [`Scrypt`](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Scrypt.html "struct scrypt::Scrypt") struct to produce/verify hash strings, it’s recommended to disable default features in your `Cargo.toml`:
```
[dependencies]
scrypt = { version = "0.2", default-features = false }
```

## [§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#usage-simple-with-default-params)Usage (simple with default params)
```
use scrypt::{
  password_hash::{
    rand_core::OsRng,
    PasswordHash, PasswordHasher, PasswordVerifier, SaltString
  },
  Scrypt
};
let password = b"hunter42"; // Bad password; don't actually use!
let salt = SaltString::generate(&mut OsRng);
// Hash password to PHC string ($scrypt$...)
let password_hash = Scrypt.hash_password(password, &salt)?.to_string();
// Verify password against PHC string
let parsed_hash = PasswordHash::new(&password_hash)?;
assert!(Scrypt.verify_password(password, &parsed_hash).is_ok());
```

## [§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#references)References
[1] - [C. Percival. Stronger Key Derivation Via Sequential Memory-Hard Functions](http://www.tarsnap.com/scrypt/scrypt.pdf)
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#reexports)

`pub use password_hash[](https://docs.rs/password-hash/0.5.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/password_hash/index.html "mod password_hash");`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#modules)

[errors](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/errors/index.html "mod scrypt::errors")
    Errors for `scrypt` operations.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#structs)

[Params](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Params.html "struct scrypt::Params")
    The Scrypt parameter values.

[Scrypt](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/struct.Scrypt.html "struct scrypt::Scrypt")
    scrypt type for use with [`PasswordHasher`](https://docs.rs/password-hash/0.5.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/password_hash/traits/trait.PasswordHasher.html "trait password_hash::traits::PasswordHasher").
## Constants[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#constants)

[ALG_ID](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/constant.ALG_ID.html "constant scrypt::ALG_ID")
    Algorithm identifier
## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/#functions)

[scrypt](https://docs.rs/scrypt/latest/scrypt/fn.scrypt.html "fn scrypt::scrypt")
    The scrypt key derivation function.

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `scrypt` crate implements the Scrypt key derivation function, a memory-hard algorithm designed for secure password hashing and verification, as specified by Colin Percival. It provides both a low-level `scrypt` function and a high-level `Scrypt` struct for hashing passwords into PHC-compliant strings and verifying them. The crate supports customizable parameters, integrates with the `password-hash` traits, and offers functionality for secure salt generation and error handling.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Key Derivation Function  
✅ Factual: The `scrypt` crate implements the Scrypt key derivation function, which is designed to be memory-hard and computationally expensive, making it resistant to brute-force attacks.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `scrypt` crate implements the PBKDF2 key derivation function, which is optimized for fast computation and low memory usage.  

---

### Pair 2: Default Features  
✅ Factual: The `scrypt` crate allows users to disable its default features in `Cargo.toml` for more granular control over dependencies, especially when using only the low-level `scrypt` function.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `scrypt` crate requires its default features to be enabled at all times in `Cargo.toml`, even for low-level usage.  

---

### Pair 3: Password Hash Verification  
✅ Factual: The `Scrypt` struct in the crate provides a high-level API for hashing passwords into PHC strings and verifying them against stored hashes.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `Scrypt` struct in the crate is only capable of hashing passwords and does not support verification against stored hashes.
